title: metadata: Span data and `SourceFile`s for macro-only dependencies can be inlined

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: A-macros
labels.description: Area: All kinds of macros (custom derive, macro_rules!, proc macros, ..)

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Some crates are only used for their macros (which are only expanded, but not reexported), but are still required to be loaded (for their spans) when loading non-macro library crates that were produced using those macros.
(It doesn't matter whether the macros are declarative or procedural.)

https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/73706 implemented a way to inline span data from such macro crates into library crates.

As a result https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/69432 can be reverted now and span data from macro-only dependencies can be inlined on as-needed basis.

The usual downside is that the same data can be inlined into multiple libraries and duplicated, instead of existing as a separate crate that is shared, however https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/73706 showed that such inlining is a cumulative improvement and can also be useful for other purposes (https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/73047).

cc @Aaron1011
